contentrichtext.text: '''Fadi Ihsan Fadel''' (born 1971) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[humanitarian]] worker who was taken [[hostage]] in [[Iraq]]. He was taken hostage on April 7, 2004 and released April 16, 2004. He was working for [[New York]]-based [[International Rescue Committee]], a [[Non-governmental organization|non-government organization]]. The key issue to his release was the emphasis to his captors that he was Canadian, not [[Israelis|Israeli]]. Fadel believes that his captors specifically targeted him as they called him by his name. ==See also== * [[2003 invasion of Iraq]] ==External links== *[http://www.cbc.ca/news/story/2004/04/16/fadel_freed040416.html CBC News: Canadian hostage freed in Iraq, phones Mom] *[http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/1082374007243_16/?hub=TopStories CTV.ca News: Fadi Fadel says he was specifically targeted] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Fadel, Fadi Ihsan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1971 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fadel, Fadi Ihsan}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Canadian people taken hostage]] [[Category:Foreign hostages in Iraq]] {{paramilitary-action-stub}}
